title.narrative: Catalyzing private investments for a green and competitive Egyptian economy

description.narrative: The Government of Egypt (GoE) is prioritizing the development of the private sector, in particular targeting SMEs. However, the #green# aspect of such SMEs development initiatives are largely missing. The objective of the proposed Joint FAO-UNDP-UNIDO Programme (the #JP#) is to support the GoE efforts by helping to green SMEs. Given their importance to the Egyptian economy, the JP has a particular focus on green SMEs, including early-stage businesses, in the agriculture and manufacturing sectors. The JP focuses in particular on SMEs that can help foster Egypt#s transition to a low-carbon, climate-resilient, energy- and resource-efficient, and circular economy. The JP will provide technical assistance to green SMEs through and in collaboration with local institutional intermediates to establish bankable green investment opportunities, including helping to mobilize further capital flows from such intermediaries (financial institutions and investors). Gender-sensitive support will be provided to women-led, owned and majority-staffed SMEs in agriculture and manufacturing sectors given their importance to the Egyptian economy. Type of financial intervention: Grants, guarantees, credit Keywords: Investment, green, circular, SMEs, blending, matchmaking, agribusiness, manufacturing
